intro: Geissorhiza alticola, commonly known as the mountain lily, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous regions, thriving in well-drained soils. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces showy blooms during the summer months. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is often cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
